children.value: Hier gaan we proberen om Turtle in een Jupyter Notebook te runnen. Dat wil zeggen: de Turtle code wordt uitgevoerd
in het notebook. Er moet dus niet een apart venster worden geopend. We willen ook geen kernel crashes of dat soort ongein.

from ipyturtle import Turtle
t = Turtle()
t

from iturtle import Turtle

def set_theme(canvas_width=800, canvas_height=800,
              canvas_color=(232/255, 210/255, 210/255),
              pen_color=(94/255, 71/255, 69/255),
              thickness=1,
              speed_value=0,
              hide_turtle=True):
    turtle = Turtle()
    turtle.setup(width=canvas_width, height=canvas_height)
    turtle.bgcolor(canvas_color)
    turtle.color(pen_color)
    turtle.width(thickness)
    turtle.speed(speed_value)
    if hide_turtle:
        turtle.hideturtle()

def euler_curve(step_size, angle_step, n_steps):
    angle = 0
    for i in range(n_steps):
        turtle.right(angle)
        turtle.forward(step_size)
        angle += angle_step

# Call set_theme before drawing the Euler curve
set_theme()
euler_curve(40, 1.00, 600)

from iturtle import Turtle

def set_theme(canvas_width=800, canvas_height=800,
              canvas_color=(232/255, 210/255, 210/255),
              pen_color=(94/255, 71/255, 69/255),
              thickness=1,
              speed_value=0,
              hide_turtle=True):
    turtle = Turtle()
    turtle.setup(width=canvas_width, height=canvas_height)
    turtle.bgcolor(canvas_color)
    turtle.color(pen_color)
    turtle.width(thickness)
    turtle.speed(speed_value)
    if hide_turtle:
        turtle.hideturtle()

def euler_curve(step_size, angle_step, n_steps):
    angle = 0
    for i in range(n_steps):
        turtle.right(angle)
        turtle.forward(step_size)
        angle += angle_step

# Call set_theme before drawing the Euler curve
set_theme()
euler_curve(40, 1.00, 60)

from iturtle import Turtle

def set_theme(pen_color=(94/255, 71/255, 69/255),
              thickness=1,
              speed_value=0,
              hide_turtle=True):
    turtle = Turtle()
    turtle.color(pen_color)
    turtle.width(thickness)
    turtle.speed(speed_value)
    if hide_turtle:
        turtle.hideturtle()

def euler_curve(step_size, angle_step, n_steps):
    angle = 0
    for i in range(n_steps):
        turtle.right(angle)
        turtle.forward(step_size)
        angle += angle_step

# Call set_theme before drawing the Euler curve
set_theme()
euler_curve(40, 1.00, 60)

from iturtle import Turtle

def euler_curve(step_size, angle_step, n_steps):
    turtle = Turtle()
    angle = 0
    for i in range(n_steps):
        turtle.right(angle)
        turtle.forward(step_size)
        angle += angle_step

euler_curve(40, 1.00, 60)

children.value:
from iturtle import Turtle

turtle.bgcolor("orange")

def euler_curve(step_size, angle_step, n_steps):
    turtle = Turtle()
    angle = 0
    for i in range(n_steps):
        turtle.right(int(angle))  # Round angle to the nearest integer
        turtle.forward(step_size)
        angle += angle_step

euler_curve(40, 1.00, 60)

children.value:
from iturtle import Turtle

# Create a global Turtle instance
turtle = Turtle()

# Set the background color
turtle.bgcolor("orange")

def euler_curve(step_size, angle_step, n_steps):
    angle = 0
    for i in range(n_steps):
        turtle.right(int(angle))  # Round angle to the nearest integer
        turtle.forward(step_size)
        angle += angle_step

euler_curve(20, 1.00, 600)

image/svg+xml.content: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 801 501" width="800" height="500"><rect width="800" height="500" fill="white"/></svg>
